alert.note: Alert for Boise Mountains; Upper Weiser River; West Central Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 21 at 2:15PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: .Heavy rain has ended and the threat of flash flooding has ended. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT/11 PM PDT/ TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of west central Idaho, including the following areas, Boise Mountains, Upper Weiser River and West Central Mountains. Portions of northeast Oregon, including the following area, Baker County. * WHEN...Until Midnight MDT/11 PM PDT/ tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Moderate rain will continue across baker county and in the Boise and West Central Mountains into early Monday evening. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Boise Mountains; Upper Weiser River; West Central Mountains
